1) Most similar end-to-end project shipped: Led an internal workflow automation from discovery → build → rollout (owned requirements, stakeholder alignment, implementation plan, and launch). Result: reduced manual turnaround time by ~40% and cut recurring errors by ~25% through clearer handoffs and lightweight QA checks.

2) Strongest tools/stack + domains: Strong in execution/ops tooling (Jira/Confluence-style workflows), data/analysis for prioritization (SQL + spreadsheets/dashboards), and cross-functional delivery in ambiguous problem spaces (process redesign, coordination across stakeholders, driving to measurable outcomes).

3) Earliest start date: Can start within 2 weeks (sooner if needed).

If this maps closely enough to what you’re prioritizing, I’d appreciate the chance to proceed (happy to re-apply immediately or do a short screen to confirm fit).

conversation.message:
Hi Company_C — as requested, here’s the 1-page-style summary ahead of Tue 11:00–11:30am ET.

Routing/automation logic (top rules):
1) Intake normalization: required fields + auto-categorization (issue type, severity, customer tier) from form/ticket metadata.
2) Priority scoring: SLA tier + severity + customer impact → priority (P0–P3) with time-based escalation thresholds.
3) Ownership assignment: route by category/product area to the right queue; if after-hours, route to on-call/backup rotation.
4) Duplicate detection: if matching customer + issue signature within X hours, link to parent and suppress redundant work.
5) Dependency gating: if missing prerequisite info, auto-request info + pause SLA clock until received (with reminders).
6) Status automation: auto-advance states (New→Triaged→In Progress→Waiting→Resolved) based on events; notify stakeholders on key transitions.
7) Aging/exception handling: if ticket idle > threshold or bounced > N times, auto-escalate to a lead + flag as “needs intervention.”

Notable edge cases:
- Misclassified tickets: override path with audit trail; model/rules updated based on weekly misroute review.
- High-priority but incomplete info: created “P0-Info Needed” lane with strict follow-ups + escalation if no response.
- Conflicting ownership (cross-area issues): split into subtasks with a single “driver” owner to prevent deadlock.

Metrics (baseline vs. post-launch):
- Cycle time (definition: ticket created → resolved; measured weekly median + p90): ~40% reduction over first 6 weeks post-launch.
- Error rate (definition: tickets requiring rework due to incorrect routing/hand-off; measured as % of total): ~25% reduction over same window.
- SLA compliance (definition: % resolved within tiered SLA): improved materially (tracked by tier; biggest gains in P1/P2).
Measurement window: baseline = 4 weeks pre-launch; post = weeks 2–7 after rollout (excluded week 1 for ramp/training noise).

Happy to go deeper on any of the rules/edge cases on the call. Looking forward to Tue.

We’re all set for **Tue 11:00–11:30am ET** via Google Meet. On the call, let’s focus on:
1) how you chose/validated the priority scoring inputs and escalation thresholds,
2) the trickiest edge case you handled end-to-end (what broke, how you detected it, what you changed), and
3) what you’d do differently if you were rebuilding this from scratch.

If anything changes with your availability before then, just let me know.

[TALK]

- what signal told you the threshold was off (false escalations vs. missed risks),
- what you changed (X value, segmentation by priority/tier, business hours vs. after-hours), and
- the measurable before/after impact.

Otherwise, we’re set. See you Tue 11:00–11:30am ET on Google Meet.
